itemDescription: captain in the Royal Navy and the Royal Air Force

wikipedia_page.main: Captain Sir John William "Jack" Alcock  (5 November 1892 – 19 December 1919) was a Royal Navy and later Royal Air Force officer who, with navigator Lieutenant Arthur Whitten Brown, piloted the first non-stop transatlantic flight from St. John's, Newfoundland to Clifden, Connemara, Ireland. He died in a flying accident in France in 1919.
